text: hi everyone love thank you such tano
here the internet's busiest music nerd
and it's time for a review of this new
avril lavigne record love sucks yes this
is a brand new lp from singer and
songwriter avril lavigne she's back or
at least that's how it feels you might
remember avril as one of canada's
greatest musical exports in the 2000s
the uncontested pop punk princess you
know despite being mostly written off by
real punk fans uh during that era during
that point in time a lot of avril's
older hits have aged astonishingly well
and have proven to have a lot of staying
power especially during a time when
chart climbing pop punk from 20 years
ago is now back in style like reliving
this whole era aesthetically is the only
reason why machine gun kelly is so
popular right now if a resurgence in a
genre is so powerful it can bring that
guy's career to new heights you know
it's big so like i said avril has come
back on this record but in actuality she
hasn't in fact she never stopped putting
out albums making a quick transition
into more straightforward pop rock
electro pop and adult contemporary
singer-songwriter stuff with her output
in the 2010s cause you know she grew up
and matured but that was her first
mistake because it's not a phase mom 20
years since the original release of let
go avril is now undergoing a pop punk
reawakening she's bringing back those
crunchy riffs the speedy tempos and the
kind of language we used to use at
sleepovers when her parents went to bed
that being said
this record in so many ways does very
much feel like a put on and not because
i think like avril's like a poser or a
fake punk or anything like that it's
more because she's not really getting in
touch with her roots as much as she is
getting in touch with what
we have in our heads as the vague idea
of her roots what i mean by that is
there are tons of tracks on avril's old
stuff especially her debut record where
they're not even punk tracks they're
just very dramatic rock ballads singer
songwriter cuts that feel more indebted
to alanis morissette than joan jett
avril's older records weren't just wall
to wall pop punk ragers even on under my
skin when she knew very well what was
kind of popping off with her hits and
her singles and could have easily just
like written 12 skater boys the most
punk single on that record he wasn't was
far from the most popular song on that
lp freaking my happy ending are you
kidding me so to be clear and call a
spade a spade avril back in the day was
more plugged into pop punk i think as an
aesthetic than a music style which isn't
a bad thing i'm just saying it makes
this sudden turn into like the hardest
[ __ ] pop punk ever on this new record
a little funny like the opening track
cannonball on this thing i don't think
an avril song has raged so freaking hard
this thing sounds tighter faster punkier
and more badass legitimately than
anything off the last blink or green day
record which yeah i know is not exactly
a high bar to pass but it does say
something about aging pop punkers and
who can still kind of pull the style off
convincingly but with this opener we got
the call and response vocals the
feedback the bitter breakup lyrics the
way the riffs kind of slow down
underneath the soaring anthemic chorus
it's by the numbers but it's done well
but unfortunately the honeymoon phase on
love sucks is over pretty quick the mgk
feature on the following song boys lie
is very tiring boys lie
because lie too like i i cannot take his
couldn't be bothered affectation that he
seems to approach every track with i
wish i could just like clip this out of
the song entirely because
it's not a bad tune overall but the
black bear feature on love it when you
hate me is even more obnoxious the uh
bars he drops like running out of books
that i could give to you
but you could still be pretty on the
inside too
like overall i think in a lot of ways
this is a better song i love the tension
building verses on the track that in a
lot of ways vocally and instrumentally
feel like a legit callback to avril's
2000s output the segway into the punky
chorus on this one is pretty much
perfect the highs the lows the ears the
nose i love it when you hate me like the
chorus on this thing has burned itself
into my head since the day i heard it
but man does this weird emo trap passage
that is forced into the whole thing
feel very much like a how do you do
fellow kids type moment we get a few
more decent ragers in the track list
with uh kiss me like the world is ending
as well as the title track
not another breakup when i think of you
i just wanna throw up with the cute
pianos i'm down for it even if some of
the riffs on this thing sound like they
were recycled from a green day record 20
years ago but those boring adult
contemporary vibes come back deeper into
the record specifically on this
overblown melodramatic
millennial ballad avalanche or as it's
said on the song avalanche yeah i'm
really not so much into this avril
launch it would be one thing if she was
kind of mellowing out on a sound that
was akin to the many ballads of her past
records but this one just feels like a
residual headache from the 2010s and
this is not the only mellow misfire on
the lp there is also dare to love me
which what is this lana del rey ass song
with the pianos and the cinematic
strings and the uh super spacey intro i
mean the finish is solid but it just
sounds really derivative despite the
fact that avril continues to be in the
pop sphere in my opinion a really
competent singer who delivers with a lot
of conviction this track stylistically
just feels so out of place with
everything else here now i know we're
not going into this lp with like the
highest lyrical standards or anything
but

fu has as solid a chorus as any other

maybe this trend didn't last forever for
